title: Fabio Buzzi, boat-builder and record-breaking offshore powerboat racer – obituary
text:
Fabio Buzzi, who has died in an accident at Venice aged 76, was a renowned figure in the world of offshore powerboat racing, both as a constructor and as a record-breaking pilot in his own right.

A ball of energy, appearing years younger than his true age, Buzzi was perhaps more admired than loved by his peers on account of his habitual frankness of speech. He was critical, for instance, of most kinds of modern ship design (the potential for cruise ships such as the Costa Concordia to sink, for instance) and of the tendency of nautical architects to lag many years behind the automotive industry in adopting new ideas.
